#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Clinical Research Medical Advisor
description:
Job Description Summary

Accountable for all country clinical/medical aspects associated with Development and prioritized Research programs/trials by providing clinical strategic and tactical leadership as the Country Clinical Development representative. May work across several countries.

Key Responsibilities:

  1. Gathers, informs, and acts on clinical/medical/scientific insights for clinical trial concept sheets/protocols, Informed Consent Forms (ICFs) and other relevant clinical documents to optimize clinical trial implementation.
  2. Drives the identification and involvement of qualified investigators with greatest recruitment potential, identifies clinical recruitment hurdles and drives clinical recruitment activities to overcome these hurdles.
  3. Accountable for adherence to safety standards and clinical data quality in the country by providing general clinical/medical support for trial related safety findings.
  4. In close collaboration with other country functions (e.g., clinical trial operations, Medical Affairs, Patient Engagement, and Patient Access) actively contributes to successful allocation, fast clinical trial start-up, timely recruitment, early identification of potential delays, and development and implementation of mitigation plans.

Major Accountabilities:

  1. Provides Clinical Development and indication expertise specific to Country/Cluster, and together with the clinical trial operations team, drives the execution of clinical trials with high quality and within planned timelines.
  2. Validates study designs, is accountable for, and makes the final decision on the clinical/medical trial and program feasibility of implementing a clinical trial protocol based on medical/clinical practice and analysis of the competitive environment in the country.
  3. Actively contributes to scientific/clinical/medical aspects of the start-up phase to ensure fast clinical trial site start-up.
  4. Provides clinical/medical expertise to clinical trial operations team members and clinical trial sites for Institutional Review Boards (IRB)/ Ethics Committee (EC) interactions.
  5. Decides on site/Country-specific scientific/clinical/medical content of the Informed Consent Form (ICF) as needed and ensures appropriateness of patient suitable language.
  6. Provides scientific/clinical/medical expertise during interactions with Country/Cluster external Experts (e.g., Regulatory Authorities, Medical Experts, Advisory Boards, Patient Advocacy Groups, etc.).
  7. Develops clinical/medical trial plans taking the broader ecosystem into account for assigned programs/trials to ensure successful trial implementation.
  8. Pro-actively identifying early on clinical challenges to recruitment or clinical data quality and drives development of clinical/medical mitigation plans.
  9. Building disease area expertise, especially for new/rare indications.
  10. Provides robust indication, compound, and protocol training to the clinical operations team in the country, especially to the Clinical Research Associates, and other country line functions as needed.
  11. Leverages innovation in clinical trial planning and decides on clinical/medical recruitment strategy and implementation based upon physician interviews, analysis of competitive trials, and patient engagement.
  12. Gathers, informs, and acts on insights from clinical trial Investigators/site staff, Medical Experts, patients, and payers, with internal Stakeholders at the Country/Cluster level with the goal to optimize clinical trial implementation.
  13. Supports planning, implementation, and follow-up of scientific/clinical/medical components of Regulatory Authority inspections and internal audits.
  14. Reviews and resolves Country trial-related scientific/clinical/medical issues/questions.
  15. Accountable for adherence to safety standards, clinical data quality for the Country/Cluster and provides general scientific/clinical/medical support for safety issues.
  16. Provides clinical/medical expertise to support pharmacovigilance activities.
  17. May be involved in reviewing the clinical/medical aspects of clinical trial Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) occurring in the Country and supports the patient safety team, and Global as needed to ensure high quality of clinical/medical information.
  18. Drives all clinical/medical activities in adherence to GCP (Good Clinical Practices), and in line with ICH (International Conference on Harmonization) and Country regulations.
  19. Provides scientific/clinical/medical input to the overall Product strategy at the Country level with an optimized cross-functional Country team.

Ideal Background:

Education: Scientific degree M.D., Ph.D., or Pharm.D. (M.D. highly desirable, > 40 % of CRMA FTEs in a country if possible). Subspecialty training and/or RWE experience desirable, but not required.

Languages: Speaks and writes English. Speaks local language (if other than English).

Experience/Professional Requirement: Skills: Ability to manage a study from the scientific/medical/clinical perspective, and a demonstrated capability to problem solve and mediate complex scientific/clinical/medical/operational issues. Ability to lead effectively by communicating well, motivating a cross-functional team, and handling and delegating responsibilities. Agility to move quickly across different therapeutic areas and indications. Demonstrated problem-solving skills and comfort with complexity. Ability to prepare and deliver high quality presentations.

Experience: Ideally, 3 years of clinical development experience in the pharmaceutical industry or clinical practice. Sound understanding of the overall clinical development process, and ICH/GCP principles.

Skills Desired: Clinical Monitoring, Clinical Research, Clinical Trial Protocol, Clinical Trials, Decision Making Skills, Drug Development, Health Sciences, Lifesciences, Regulatory Compliance.

Na Coca-Cola Andina Brasil , nada é tão importante quanto os nossos colaboradores; por isso, oferecemos um pacote de benefícios que permite uma vida mais saudável e completa. Venha conhecer como fazemos a magia acontecer para você:

Com o suporte de uma equipe especializada da operadora de saúde, dispomos de programas para acompanhamento de doenças crônicas.

E não é só isso; pensando no bem-estar físico, psicológico, social, financeiro e jurídico, seu e de toda sua família disponibilizamos o Gympass e o Pack para Você, extensivo a dependentes .

Para dar aquele gás, oferecemos Vale Alimentação e/ou Vale Refeição (conforme elegibilidade ). Se você trabalhar em uma das nossas fábricas, temos restaurante .

Para dar um refresco no início do ano e deixar a criançada animada, oferecemos Kit Escolar (conforme elegibilidade).

Para refrescar momentos importantes, temos descontos com aquele gás, Venda ao Colaborador .

Participação nos Resultados da Cia para todos.

Gostamos de aprender e compartilhar conhecimento; aqui, temos diversas iniciativas de aprendizagem e desenvolvimento , como Portal do Conhecimento , parcerias com instituições de ensino, entre outras.

#Venha fazer parte do Time e compartilhar Felicidade com a gente!

Na Coca-Cola Andina Brasil, como parte do nosso propósito, valorizamos a diversidade e estamos comprometidos com a promoção da inclusão e equidade em nossos times.

Por isso, em todas as nossas vagas, encorajamos a candidatura de pessoas com deficiência, pessoas negras (pretas e pardas), mulheres, pessoas da comunidade LGBTQIA+ e de diferentes idades e nacionalidades.
